We are currently about 2/3rds of the way thru the approval process to move to Michigan State University. There is an important meeting on the 17th, after which we may get a reasonable date to move.

Currently, we are operating off the following machines:

  • DB0 - Dual Athlon 1800MP, 1gb of RAM, two 18gb SCSI drives
  • DB1 - Athlon 2100, 1gb of RAM, two 18 gig SCSI drives and 1 120 IDE drive
  • web0 - P3 500mhz, 512mb RAM
  • web3 - P3 600mhz, 512mb RAM

The following machines are sitting loaded in my office and will be integrated into the cluster for the move:

  • web1 - Athlon 2400, 1gb of RAM, 1 40gb + 1 80gb IDE drive - [avalyn]'s donation.
  • DB2 - Dual-core Athlon 3800+, 2 80gb SATA2 drives, 2gb 800mhz RAM - Donations funded new machine.
  • web2 - Sempron 2600, 768mb RAM, 120gb IDE drive - [nate]'s donation, but is currently having random reboot issues.

When we move, I will likely set up the site entirely on the new hardware at MSU and change the domain so we will not require much downtime. I will then gather the old hardware and reload it with our new standard install which is Ubuntu server 6.06.

If anyone has other machines they would like to donate which are P4/Athlon 2000+ or faster, or any gigabit networking hardware, please email me.

UpdateSomeone has generously donated two additional machines and some networking gear and some hard drives. Thanks a bunch, I think I should be able to put this stuff together.

--[nate]
